page.title: 14THE DOVER-DEAL RAILWAY LINE
page.content: The Dover and Deal Joint Railway was opened on 17 June 1881. It was a rare example of co-operation between two rival private companies;The South Eastern Railway and the London,Chatham and Dover Railway. To complete their venture the partners had to dig out the 1412 yards long Guston Tunnel. Once open the line served not only Dover and Deal but two communities in-between,for intermediate stations were opened at Walmer and Martin Mill. It encouraged the growth of the latter village which,in the inter-war period was advertised as "The Station for St.Margaret's Bay with it's sandy beach." Since 1945 the number of tourists using the line has declined and local villages,especially Martin Mill,have grown as dormitories for the larger towns on the line like Dover.
